required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperatively Walking's Effect of Postoperative Bowel Functions in Patient With Gynecologic Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: Jinekolojik Kanserler Nedeni Ile Opere Edilen Hastalarda Preoperatif yürümenin Postoperatif Barsak fonksiyonlarına Etkisi

lead_sponsor.agency: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Preoperative walking's effect of postoperative bowel functions ASA 1 or 2 in patient with gynecologic cancers.

study_design_info.masking_description: Doctor who evaluate bowel function will not know whether patients walked or not

primary_outcome.measure: the time to the first passage of flatus after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Doctor will detect the time with auscultation

secondary_outcome.description: Doctor will detect the time with auscultation
Doctor will detect the time with auscultation

arm_group.description: Patients will be operated gynecologic cancers and have American Society of Anesthesia score 1 or 2. Subjects will walk during one hour with average speed 3 km/hour 12 hour before surgery.
Patients will be operated gynecologic cancers and have American Society of Anesthesia score 1 or 2. Subjects will not walk preoperatively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with gynecological cancer ASA score 1 or 2 via laparascopy or laparatomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- ASA score >2 orthopedic problems ileostomy or colostomy >24 hours stay in intensive care unit early postoperative complications (relaparotomy, massive blood transfusion)

facility.name: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Training and Research Hospital

results_reference.citation: Güngördük K, Özdemir İA, Güngördük Ö, Gülseren V, Gokçü M, Sancı M. Effects of coffee consumption on gut recovery after surgery of gynecological cancer patients: a randomized controlled trial. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2017 Feb;216(2):145.e1-145.e7. doi: 10.1016/j.ajog.2016.10.019. Epub 2016 Oct 22.
